  • Uses of Unit in components

    Subclasses of Unit in components
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Cavalry
    Cavalry unit stats.
    class  Militia
    Class containing unit stats for the militia unit.
    class  Scout
    Basic setup for a scout unit which has higher movement and sight.
    class  Settler
    Basic setup for a settler unit, which can only move and found cities.
    class  Swordsman
    Subclass containing stats for the swordsman unit.
    class  Warrior
    Subclass containing stats for the warrior unit.
    Fields in components declared as Unit
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Unit Tile.unitHere  
    Methods in components that return Unit
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Unit Tile.getUnit()
    Return unit stationed on this tile.
    Unit City.produceUnit​(java.lang.String unitType)
    A new unit has been purchased in this city, create and return it.
    Methods in components with parameters of type Unit
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void Tile.setUnit​(Unit unit)
    Place a unit on this tile, will be used if a unit moves here or if a unit kills the unit stationed here.

  • Uses of Unit in controllers

    Methods in controllers with parameters of type Unit
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void CivController.computerAttackerActions​(Unit u)
    Actions for computer units that move towards and attack enemy cities.
    private void CivController.computerDefenderActions​(Unit u)
    Actions that the computer takes for the first two non-settler units.
    java.util.HashSet<int[]> CivController.getValidMoves​(Unit unit)
    Returns a set of all the valid moves that the given unit can currently make.
    private void CivController.moveTowards​(Unit u, java.lang.Integer[] target)
    Moves the unit towards the target coords by searching for the ideal move first, then choosing any good move, and moving randomly if there is no "good" move.
    boolean CivController.moveUnit​(Unit toMove, int newX, int newY)
    Moves a unit from its old location to the new player-specified location.
    private void CivController.revealTiles​(Unit unit)
    Set all the tiles in the unit's sight range around the given location as revealed for that unit's owner.

    private java.util.ArrayList<Unit> Player.units  
    Methods in models that return types with arguments of type Unit
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Unit> Player.getUnits()
    getUnits() returns the collection of Units that belong to this Player for the controller
    Methods in models with parameters of type Unit
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void Player.addUnit​(Unit unit)
    addUnit() adds a new Unit Object to the list of Units this player owns
    void Player.removeUnit​(Unit unit)
    Remove a Unit from this Player's Unit collection (for use when Unit dies or Settler settles city)
